title.value: The use of dose surface maps as a tool to investigate spatial dose delivery accuracy for the rectum during prostate radiotherapy
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the research on using dose surface maps to investigate the spatial accuracy of dose delivery to the rectum during prostate radiotherapy.
title.quote: The use of dose surface maps as a tool to investigate spatial dose delivery accuracy for the rectum during prostate radiotherapy

extractions.description: This study explores the use of dose surface maps (DSMs) as a method to evaluate and compare the spatial accuracy of planned versus delivered doses to the rectum during prostate radiotherapy. Through analyzing results from 40 patients undergoing different radiation treatment plans (SBRT and IMRT), the study found that DSMs offer a more nuanced understanding of dose discrepancies and interfraction motion than traditional dose-volume histograms (DVHs), potentially improving dose delivery accuracy assessments.

type.justification: The paper is based on data collected from patient cohorts receiving radiotherapy, and involves retrospective calculation and comparison of dose delivery using methodologies like dose surface maps and dose-volume histograms.
type.quote: A retrospective single-center patient cohort... were identified for this study...

name.justification: The study is set in the context of radiation therapy, focusing specifically on the delivery of planned versus delivered doses in prostate cancer treatment.
name.quote: Purpose: This study aims to address the lack of spatial dose comparisons of planned and delivered rectal doses during prostate radiotherapy...

name.justification: The research involves the application of physics to medicine, particularly in the accurate delivery of radiotherapy.
name.quote: Medical Physics Unit, McGill University, Montreal, Quebec, Canada.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm for dose recalculation on CBCT images.
name.quote: Full-course prescription doses were recalculated on CBCT images using Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm (v.15.6.06)...

is_contributed.justification: The Analytical Anisotropic Algorithm is used but not developed as part of this study.
is_contributed.quote: Full-course prescription doses were recalculated on CBCT images using Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm...

is_executed.justification: The model is used conceptually for dose recalculations and does not require execution on specific hardware like GPU or CPU as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: Full-course prescription doses were recalculated on CBCT images using Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm...

is_compared.justification: The algorithm is a tool used for recalculation and does not have a numerical comparison with other algorithms in the study.
is_compared.quote: Full-course prescription doses were recalculated on CBCT images using Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not reference a specific title for the algorithm. It is likely a standard tool within the Eclipse system.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ... using Eclipse’s analytical anisotropic algorithm (v.15.6.06) and CBCT-specific HU-electron density curves...

name.justification: The paper refers to the use of deformable image registration software to calculate total delivered dose distributions.
name.quote: More recently, studies have begun to explicitly calculate total delivered dose distributions using deformable image registration (DIR) software to properly account for spatial dose variations...

is_contributed.justification: The use of DIR software is referenced from other studies and not developed within this paper.
is_contributed.quote: More recently, studies have begun to explicitly calculate total delivered dose distributions using deformable image registration (DIR) software...

is_executed.justification: The focus is on refraining from using it due to quality standard issues rather than actual execution within this study.
is_executed.quote: We chose this method of daily-delivered dose calculation over deformably registering planning CTs to daily anatomy due to the inability of our available clinical deformable registration software to meet TG-132 recommended quality standards...

is_compared.justification: There is no explicit numerical comparison involving the DIR software.
is_compared.quote: More recently, studies have begun to explicitly calculate total delivered dose distributions using deformable image registration (DIR) software...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not mention a specific reference for the DIR software, as it discusses the context of its use generally in radiotherapy.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Deformable image registration for radiation therapy...

name.justification: The paper focuses on DSMs as a novel tool to evaluate spatial dose delivery, contributing to assessing their benefit over traditional DVHs.
name.quote: The purpose of this study was to compare the ability of DVHs and DSMs to evaluate differences between planned and delivered rectum doses...

is_contributed.justification: The paper's central contribution is using DSMs to analyze spatial dose delivery accuracy in radiotherapy applications.
is_contributed.quote: Conclusion: DSMs enabled spatial investigations of planned and delivered doses can uncover associations with interfraction motion...

is_executed.justification: DSMs are utilized to derive dose comparisons and findings within this study, which implies execution.
is_executed.quote: Generation of DSMs was achieved using rtdsm, an open-source Python package previously developed by our group for DSM calculation and analysis.

is_compared.justification: DSMs are compared to DVHs in terms of their ability to evaluate differences in dose delivery.
is_compared.quote: The purpose of this study was to compare the ability of DVHs and DSMs to evaluate differences between planned and delivered rectum doses...

referenced_paper_title.justification: Dose Surface Maps are not tied to a specific external paper but are discussed as a methodological approach developed by the authors themselves.
referenced_paper_title.quote: DSMs have become a popular tool for dose-outcome studies of hollow organs...

name.justification: Throughout the paper, DVHs are used as a traditional method to compare against DSMs in the context of assessing radiotherapy accuracy.
name.quote: The purpose of this study was to compare the ability of DVHs and DSMs to evaluate differences between planned and delivered rectum doses...

is_contributed.justification: DVHs are standard tools and not developed as a new contribution in this study.
is_contributed.quote: DVHs have long been recognized to be limited by their lack of spatial information...

is_executed.justification: DVHs are executed as part of the analysis for dose delivery accuracy in the study.
is_executed.quote: Planned and daily rectum DVHs... for each patient were extracted from their DICOM-RT dose files using a custom Python script.

is_compared.justification: DVHs are directly compared to DSMs in the study to assess their relative effectiveness in representing dose delivery accuracy.
is_compared.quote: The purpose of this study was to compare the ability of DVHs and DSMs to evaluate differences between planned and delivered rectum doses...

referenced_paper_title.justification: DVHs are a commonly used concept in dose measurement and not tied to a specific reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: DVHs have long been recognized to be limited by their lack of spatial information, making it possible for differences between dose distributions to be masked if they yield similar DVH metrics.

name.justification: The study evaluates patients from two cohorts: those treated with SBRT and those with IMRT, focusing on accumulated doses using different methodologies.
name.quote: A retrospective single-center patient cohort consisting of 20 patients with localized prostate cancer treated consecutively with SBRT...

referenced_paper_title.value: Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy or Intensity-Modulated Radiation Therapy in Treating Patients With Stage IIA-B Prostate Cancer (NRG-GU005)
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to the guidelines for SBRT indicates reliance on external standards, as mentioned by the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: ...designed for each patient in accordance with appropriate protocols: local published guidelines for the IMRT cohort, 21 and NRG-GU005 guidelines for the SBRT cohort.

name.justification: The paper involves evaluating doses in a group of patients treated with IMRT.
name.quote: As it was also of interest to use DSMs to evaluate dose delivery accuracy for longer treatments, a second cohort of 20 patients with localized prostate cancer who were treated with IMRT to 60 Gy in 20 fractions...

referenced_paper_title.value: Hypofractionated radiation therapy for prostate cancer: the McGill University Health Center experience
referenced_paper_title.justification: The study describes previous data used concerning IMRT treatments, affiliated with existing centers and their protocols.
referenced_paper_title.quote: local published guidelines for the IMRT cohort, 21 and NRG-GU005 guidelines for the SBRT cohort.

name.justification: The paper states the use of rtdsm, an open-source package, for calculating DSMs.
name.quote: Generation of DSMs was achieved using rtdsm, an open-source Python package previously developed by our group for DSM calculation and analysis.

referenced_paper_title.value: Technical note: rtdsm-An open-source software for radiotherapy dose-surface map generation and analysis.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference to the rtdsm package is based on previous developments by the authors for calculating DSMs, indicating its roots in their prior work.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Generation of DSMs was achieved using rtdsm, an open-source Python package previously developed by our group for DSM calculation and analysis.
